definition: the First Emperor's order to expel foreigners/(fig.) notice to leave/words or behavior intended at turning visitors out
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
to ask sb to leave/to show sb the door/to give a tenant notice to leave

sentences.english: We bit our tongues the entire weekend to keep from telling him where to go!
sentences.chinese: 整個週末我們強忍住未向他下逐客令。

sentences.english: Cloud crazy detected a Lord LvZhuang next marching orders, some dissatisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 雲狂察覺出呂莊主在下逐客令，有些不滿。

sentences.english: He grew sarcastic very quickly and asked me to leave.
sentences.chinese: 很快，他就開始挖苦我，然後下了逐客令。

sentences.english: He wouldn't listen to my apology and showed me the door.
sentences.chinese: 他對我的道歉連聽也不聽便下逐客令。

definition: to ask sb to leave/to show sb the door/to give a tenant notice to leave
to storm off in a huff (idiom)
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
